movies.title: Who Was Maddox?
movies.plot: A publisher is nearly framed for murder, but he appears to have been goaded by the blackmailer who has also blackmailed the publisher's wife.
movies.simplePlot: A publisher is nearly framed for murder, but he appears to have been goaded by the blackmailer who has also blackmailed the publisher's wife.

biography.bio: Christa Bergmann is an actress, known for Who Was Maddox? (1964), Emergency-Ward 10 (1957) and The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre (1960).
biography.name: Christa Bergmann

biography.bio: James Bree was born on July 20, 1923 in East Coker, Somerset, England as James Rutherford Worsfold Thomson. He was an actor, known for On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969), Without a Clue (1988) and Evil Heritage (1976). He died on December 1, 2008 in London, England.
biography.name: James Bree

biography.bio: Dallas Cavell was born on September 19, 1925 in the UK as Norman Dallas Cavell. He was an actor, known for Doctor Who (1963), A Wedding (1961) and Rembrandt (1971). He was married to Kay Clayton. He died on February 15, 1993 in London, England.
biography.name: Dallas Cavell

biography.bio: Scottish-born Finlay Currie was a former church organist and choirmaster who made his stage debut at 20 years of age. It took him 34 more years before making his first film, but he worked steadily for another 30 years after that. Although he was a large, imposing figure, with a rich, deep voice and somewhat authoritarian demeanor, he was seldom cast in villainous parts. He received great acclaim for his role as Magwitch in Great Expectations (1946), and one of his best remembered roles was as Shunderson, Cary Grant's devoted servant with a secret past, in People Will Talk (1951). Later in life he became a much respected antiques dealer, specializing in coins and precious metals. He died in England at age 90.
biography.name: Finlay Currie

biography.bio: Lawrence Davidson was born on April 7, 1927. He was an actor, known for The Dogs of War (1980), Curse of the Pink Panther (1983) and The Survivor (1961). He died on October 14, 2000 in London, England.
biography.name: Lawrence Davidson

biography.bio: Richard Gale was born on November 1, 1921 in Basford, Nottinghamshire, England as Eric Richard Gale. He was an actor, known for The Miniver Story (1950), Meet Mr. Malcolm (1954) and The Madame Gambles (1951). He was married to Claire Pollock. He died on October 25, 1983 in Hampstead, London, England.
biography.name: Richard Gale

biography.bio: Daphne Goddard was born on January 10, 1925 in Lewisham, London, England as Daphne Carless Goddard. She was an actress, known for Prime Suspect: Inner Circles (1995), The Eye of Allah (1960) and The Girl (1996). She died on June 6, 2005 in Denville Hall, Northwood, Hillingdon, London.
biography.name: Daphne Goddard

biography.bio: Best remembered as 'M' in the James Bond films, Bernard Lee was a popular character player in British films throughout the 1950s and 1960s. Born into a theatrical family, he made his stage debut at age six and later attended the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. He first appeared on the West End stage in London in 1928, and continued to work in the theatre during the 1930s, taking only occasional film roles. It was only after World War II that he concentrated his efforts on the cinema, and was much in demand in British films of the 1950s as friendly authority figures, including army sergeants, police detectives or navy officers. Detectives became a particular specialty, and he played this role in more than a dozen films, including The Blue Lamp (1950), Beat the Devil (1953) and The Detective (1954). In the early 1960s, he also made regular appearances as police detectives in the The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre (1960) second feature series, usually as "Inspector Meredith". He also made memorable appearances in The Third Man (1949), Operation Disaster (1950), Glory at Sea (1952), Pursuit of the Graf Spee (1956), Dunkirk (1958) and Whistle Down the Wind (1961). He was effectively cast against type in only two films, as the union agitator in The Angry Silence (1960), and as a disgruntled civil servant who becomes a spy for the Russians in Ring of Treason (1964). In 1962, he made his first appearance as the head of the British secret service in the first James Bond film, Dr. No (1962). He went on to be featured in the next ten films in the series, appearing with Sean Connery, George Lazenby and, later, Roger Moore as Bond, and will probably be considered the definitive "M" by more than one generation of Bond fans.
biography.name: Bernard Lee

biography.bio: Suzanne Lloyd was born on November 11, 1934 in Toronto, Canada. She is an actress, known for Pépé (1960), That Riviera Touch (1966) and The Return of Mr. Moto (1965).
biography.name: Suzanne Lloyd

biography.bio: Billy Milton was born on December 8, 1905 in Paddington, London, England as William Thomas Milton. He was an actor and composer, known for Saturday Night Revue (1937), Monster of Terror (1965) and Someone at the Door (1936). He died on November 22, 1989 in Denville Hall, Northwood, London.
biography.name: Billy Milton

biography.bio: A refugee from the Nazi regime as a child, Dora trained and danced briefly with the Vienna Opera as their youngest solo dancer until an accidental fall in her late teens ended her dancing career. She then moved to London and studied theatre at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in London, where she had to improve her English skills as well through classes. After a career on British television, in a few Hollywood films and on the stage, she gave up acting career to raise a family and beginning in the 1980's, she became one of Britain's leading fashion designers.
biography.name: Dora Reisser

biography.bio: Ivor Salter was born on August 22, 1925 in Taunton, Somerset, England as Ivor Charley Salter. He was an actor, known for House of Whipcord (1974), When Strangers Meet (1964) and Be My Guest (1965). He died on June 21, 1991 in Warwickshire, England.
biography.name: Ivor Salter

biography.bio: Michael Stainton was born in 1935 in Halifax, West Yorkshire, England. He is an actor, known for Metal Mickey (1980), Harold Shipman: Doctor Death (2002) and You Must Be the Husband (1987).
biography.name: Michael Stainton

biography.bio: Jack Watling was born on January 13, 1923 in Chingford, Essex, England as Jack Stanley Watling. He was an actor, known for The Power Game (1965), The Plane Makers (1963) and The Cedar Tree (1976). He was married to Patricia Hicks. He died on May 22, 2001 in Chelmsford, Essex.
biography.name: Jack Watling
